meanings.definition: To enclose or surround in a sphere.
meanings.sent1: The magician insphered the rabbit in a crystal ball.
meanings.sent2: She insphered her precious jewelry in a glass dome for display.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat insphered the toy mouse in a snow globe.
meanings.sent4: The artist insphered the model in a bubble of light for the photoshoot.
meanings.sent5: The scientist insphered the tiny organism in a tiny glass sphere for observation.

meanings.definition: To place in or as if in a sphere.
meanings.sent1: The children insphered their toys in a circle on the floor.
meanings.sent2: He insphered the planets in a model solar system for the science fair.
meanings.sent3: The chef insphered the ingredients in a mixing bowl to prepare the cake.
meanings.sent4: The architect insphered the building in a virtual reality simulation.
meanings.sent5: The gardener insphered the flowers in a beautiful glass terrarium.

meanings.sent1: She insphered the dough into perfect little balls for baking.
meanings.sent2: The potter insphered the clay into a round vase on the wheel.
meanings.sent3: The children insphered the snow into snowballs for a playful fight.
meanings.sent4: The artist insphered the paint into colorful spheres on the canvas.
meanings.sent5: The chef insphered the ice cream into scoops for the dessert.
